Both the Obama administration's auto task force and Sergio Marchionne insisted that the dealer network be shrunk to accelerate the consolidation of four brands in every showroom and to reduce intra-brand competition in metropolitan areas. They also said they will not spend money marketing vehicles until they are in the showroom, said Lonnie Cobb, who owns Humboldt Chrysler-Jeep-Dodge-Ram in Humboldt, Tenn. The presentation was made by three of Chrysler's four brand CEOs-- Fred Diaz for Ram truck, Ralph Gilles for Dodge and Mike Manley for Jeep
